meanings.definition: A person who delays or postpones tasks or decisions.
meanings.sent1: Some procrastinators struggle to start their work until the last minute.
meanings.sent2: Procrastinators often find it hard to begin tasks right away.
meanings.sent3: The procrastinators in the group joked about starting their project next year.
meanings.sent4: She compared the team to a group of procrastinators waiting until the eleventh hour.
meanings.sent5: The image of procrastinators rushing to finish their work at the deadline stuck in her mind.

meanings.definition: Those who habitually put off doing things.
meanings.sent1: Many procrastinators feel stressed due to their habit of delaying tasks.
meanings.sent2: Procrastinators often struggle with time management due to their tendency to delay.
meanings.sent3: The procrastinators at the office decided to postpone the meeting for no reason.
meanings.sent4: The room full of procrastinators resembled a group of turtles moving slowly.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's advice helped some procrastinators break the cycle of delaying important tasks.
